hook.text: Greg McKeown says: if you don't prioritize your life, someone else will. That's the core of Essentialism.

buildup.text: Essentialism is the disciplined pursuit of less but better. It rejects the myth that we can do it all.

discovery.text: Essentialists ask: what is the one thing I can do that makes everything else easier or unnecessary?

twist.text: Non-essentialism feels productive because you're always busy. But busy isn't the same as making progress.

climax.text: The essentialist trade-off: less output but higher impact. Fewer commitments but deeper engagement.

punchline.text: Less but better. That's the entire strategy.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of Essentialism?
options: The disciplined pursuit of less but better
Doing as many tasks as possible
